title: Hold Still: UK lockdown caught on camera
description: Pictures taken by members of the public for an online exhibition capturing four months of lockdown.

title: Nigeria's slave descendants prevented from marrying who they want
description: Campaigners fight to overturn customs and a caste system that discriminates against some Igbo people.

title: How her own illness led one woman to set up a global firm
description: Jules Miller set up dietary supplements firm The Nue Co after suffering irritable bowel syndrome.

title: Criminal Records: Singer creates label for jailhouse Scots
description: Jill Brown says the new label will give "a voice" to musically-minded inmates at HMP Barlinnie.

title: David Tennant says TV drama Des 'does not celebrate' killer Dennis Nilsen
description: The actor explains why he played the notorious mass murderer as "boring" in a new TV drama.

title: ‘I came from a mother and baby home’
description: Eunan Duffy was 47 years old when he found out he was adopted and reconnected with his birth mother.

title: Covid in Yemen: The city where all the doctors fled - except one
description: During the height of the pandemic in Yemen, there was only one functioning hospital in the city of Aden, home to a million people.

title: Coronavirus: Beijing's back and forth lockdown
description: Stephen McDonell explores 'the new normal’ in China's capital as it adapts to life with coronavirus.

title: Tottenham 0-1 Everton: James Rodriguez shows Spurs what they are missing - Jermaine Jenas analysis
description: MOTD2 pundit Jermaine Jenas is impressed by Everton but left confused and disappointed by Tottenham's performance in their season opener.

title: 'Firm and strong' EU response expected - Taoiseach Martin
description: Taoiseach Micheál Martin cautioned the UK government over "playing politics" with negotiations.

title: Brexit: Buckland says power to override Withdrawal Agreement is 'insurance policy'
description: Justice Secretary Robert Buckland says he would resign if the UK broke the rule of law in a way he found unacceptable.

title: Sue Barker leaving BBC's A Question of Sport after 24 years
description: Team captains Matt Dawson and Phil Tufnell will also depart the long-running BBC sports quiz show.

title: Nazanin Zaghari-Ratcliffe: New trial postponed in Iran
description: The British-Iranian woman was expecting fresh charges in court - four years after her initial arrest.

title: M5 crash: Motorway closed in Gloucestershire
description: Police were called to a crash involving several vehicles at about 05:20 BST.

title: Los Angeles police officers shot in 'ambush'
description: Video of the incident shows a figure approach their vehicle, before opening fire and running away.

title: Bernadette Walker: Second murder arrest in hunt for missing teen
description: A man and a woman are being questioned over the disappearance of Bernadette Walker, 17.

title: Coronavirus: Cases in France leap past 10,000 a day
description: Hospitalisations and intensive care admissions also rise across the country as infections soar.

title: After covid: 'Working from home' is long term ambition
description: Nearly a third of people should still work from home even when coronavirus eases, say ministers.

title: RAF intercepts Russian aircraft off Scottish coast
description: The RAF Typhoons, which are currently operating from Leuchars in Fife, made the interception.

title: Inhaling nitrous oxide was poor judgement - Greenwood
description: Manchester United's Mason Greenwood says it was "poor judgement" to inhale nitrous oxide, after "historical pictures" of him doing so were published by the Sun.

title: US film Nomadland triumphs at Venice Film Festival
description: The festival was the first such event held with live audiences since the start of Covid-19 outbreak.

title: Coronavirus: Disposable masks 'causing enormous plastic waste'
description: The government is urged to do more to get people to wear reusable, washable face coverings.

title: Subdued Proms concludes after Rule, Britannia! row
description: Social distancing meant there was no place for promenaders this year at the Royal Albert Hall.

title: National eczema week: 'I wanted to rip my skin off'
description: A survey finds 89% of adults with eczema feel it significantly reduces their quality of life.

title: 'Music gives my Down’s syndrome son a voice'
description: Jack Rogers began taking piano lessons through video calls during the coronavirus lockdown.

title: The Papers: Care home cases 'spiral', and PM's legal backlash
description: Sunday's papers report on the mounting criticism Boris Johnson faces over plans to breach the Brexit deal.

title: 'I've tried to mature' - Osaka on how coronavirus break helped her win US Open
description: US Open champion Naomi Osaka says the time she was forced to take off tennis because of the coronavirus pandemic helped her win a third Grand Slam.
